summaries.brief_summary: Fixed js_of_ocaml installation failures caused by incompatible patch files
summaries.new_features_summary: Updated js_of_ocaml patches to fix installation failures on macOS with opam 2.4.1
summaries.new_features: - Fixed **js_of_ocaml installation failures** by updating patch files that were not applying cleanly on macOS with opam 2.4.1, resolving compatibility issues with the gpatch utility ([#11](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/11))
summaries.activity_summary: Community collaboration on patch compatibility issues with cross-platform testing feedback
summaries.activity:
- **Patch compatibility testing** across different platforms with [Matthew Else](https://github.com/matthewelse) reporting successful installation on macOS with opam 2.3.0 and [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) identifying breakage on macOS with opam 2.4.1 ([#11](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/11))
- **Cross-platform collaboration** between maintainers to diagnose patch application issues, with discussion of potential regression related to builtin patch functionality ([#11](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/11))
summaries.discussions_summary: Technical troubleshooting discussion about opam version and patch utility compatibility
summaries.notable_discussions: - **Patch application debugging** discussion involving [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam), [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm), and [Matthew Else](https://github.com/matthewelse) investigating differences in patch behavior across opam versions and operating systems, with reference to potential involvement of [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) for opam expertise ([#11](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/11))
summaries.contributors_summary: Matthew Else implemented patch fixes with collaborative testing and review from maintainers
summaries.contributors:
- [Matthew Else](https://github.com/matthewelse) implemented the js_of_ocaml patch fixes, updating patch files and checksums across multiple js_of_ocaml packages ([#11](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/11))
- [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) provided testing feedback and engaged in technical troubleshooting discussions about patch compatibility ([#11](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/11))
- [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) identified the regression issue on macOS with opam 2.4.1 and provided detailed error information for debugging ([#11](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/11))

summaries.brief_summary: Package maintenance focused on js_of_ocaml patches, toolchain updates, and new library integrations for OCaml documentation tools
summaries.new_features_summary: Fixed js_of_ocaml toplevel functionality, upgraded utop to 2.16.0, and integrated eio async I/O library with odoc documentation tools
summaries.new_features:
- **js_of_ocaml toplevel support** enabled for Oxcaml through unified patches by [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) incorporating [@patricoferris](https://github.com/patricoferris) patches ([#7](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/7))
- **iarray primitives patch fixes** for js_of_ocaml installation issues resolved by [Matthew Else](https://github.com/matthewelse) ([#11](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/11))
- **utop upgrade** to version 2.16.0 with updated patches by [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) ([#10](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/10))
- **eio async I/O library integration** including eio_main, eio_posix, and eio_linux packages with patches from [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) ([#8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/8))
- **odoc documentation toolchain** packages added including odoc-driver, odoc-parser, odoc-md, and sherlodoc from oxcaml organization ([#8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/8))
- **mdx documentation tool** updated with unit-info patches and switched to git+https source URLs for better maintenance ([#9](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/9))
- **ocaml-lsp-server compatibility** improvements with current odoc-parser versions ([#8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/8))
summaries.activity_summary: Repository consolidation efforts moved package sources to oxcaml organization repositories with git+https URLs replacing patch-based maintenance
summaries.activity:
- **Package source consolidation** by [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) switching from patch-based maintenance to direct git+https URLs pointing to oxcaml organization repositories ([#8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/8), [#9](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/9))
- **Cross-platform compatibility** improvements addressing macOS-specific build issues with gpatch vs patch differences discussed by [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) and [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) ([#11](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/11))
- **Patch unification** across js_of_ocaml package variants ensuring consistency between js_of_ocaml-compiler, js_of_ocaml-ppx, js_of_ocaml-toplevel, and wasm_of_ocaml-compiler ([#7](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/7))
- **Maintenance workflow optimization** replacing individual patch file updates with direct repository references for easier long-term maintenance ([#8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/8))
summaries.trends_summary: Migration from patch-based to repository-based package maintenance and expansion of OCaml toolchain support for modern async I/O and documentation
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Repository-based package maintenance** trend emerging with migration from patch files to direct git+https URLs pointing to oxcaml organization forks ([#8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/8), [#9](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/9))
- **Modern OCaml toolchain integration** focus on async I/O capabilities with eio library family and comprehensive documentation tooling ([#8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/8))
- **Cross-platform build robustness** attention to macOS-specific toolchain differences and patch application compatibility ([#11](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/11))
summaries.contributors_summary: Jon Ludlam led package maintenance and toolchain integration while Matthew Else resolved js_of_ocaml build issues with cross-platform testing
summaries.contributors:
- [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) implemented js_of_ocaml toplevel patches ([#7](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/7)), integrated odoc and eio packages ([#8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/8)), updated mdx tooling ([#9](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/9)), and upgraded utop to 2.16.0 ([#10](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/10))
- [Matthew Else](https://github.com/matthewelse) diagnosed and fixed js_of_ocaml installation failures on macOS by updating iarray primitives patches ([#11](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/11))
- [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) provided eio library patches and participated in cross-platform build troubleshooting discussions ([#8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/8), [#11](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/11))

summaries.brief_summary: Added comprehensive odoc toolchain packages and patched eio library for Oxcaml compatibility
summaries.new_features_summary: Complete odoc documentation toolchain with driver, parser, markdown support, and patched eio async I/O library
summaries.new_features:
- **Odoc documentation toolchain** integration with full package suite including `odoc`, `odoc-parser`, `odoc-driver`, `odoc-md`, and `sherlodoc` packages ([#8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/8))
- **Eio async I/O library** added with platform-specific packages `eio`, `eio_posix`, `eio_linux`, and `eio_main` for effect-based direct-style I/O ([#8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/8))
- **Ocaml-lsp-server compatibility** improvements with patch for current `odoc-parser` integration ([7ced23c5d](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/7ced23c5d63a57ac73e250298adbdbc3de3cd629))
- **Git+https source URLs** migration for better maintainability instead of patch files for `mdx` package ([#9](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/9))
summaries.activity_summary: Focus on documentation toolchain completion and source management improvements with repository URL standardization
summaries.activity:
- **Documentation ecosystem** integration work by [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) establishing complete odoc toolchain with cross-package dependencies for Oxcaml development ([#8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/8))
- **Source management** improvements moving from patch-based approach to direct git repository references with checksums for easier maintenance ([#8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/8), [#9](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/9))
- **Cross-repository coordination** with references to [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm)'s eio fork for Oxcaml-specific patches until upstream integration
summaries.trends_summary: Shift towards comprehensive documentation tooling and standardized source repository management
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Documentation-first approach** with complete odoc toolchain integration suggesting focus on improving developer experience and API documentation quality
- **Git-based source management** replacing patch files with direct repository references and checksums for more maintainable package definitions
- **Cross-repository collaboration** between oxcaml organization and individual maintainer forks for testing and integration before upstream contributions
summaries.contributors_summary: Jon Ludlam drove the documentation toolchain integration and source management improvements
summaries.contributors:
- [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) implemented the complete odoc documentation toolchain including `odoc-driver`, `sherlodoc`, and related packages ([#8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/8)), added the eio async I/O library with platform-specific variants ([#8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/8)), updated mdx package to use git+https source URLs ([#9](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/9)), and patched ocaml-lsp-server for odoc-parser compatibility
- [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) provided the eio patches referenced in the package sources for Oxcaml-specific modifications

summaries.brief_summary: Js_of_ocaml toplevel support implementation with patch unification across all related packages
summaries.new_features_summary: Added js_of_ocaml toplevel functionality with effects support and sourcemap improvements
summaries.new_features:
- **Js_of_ocaml toplevel support** enabling interactive OCaml toplevel functionality in browsers with accompanying **effects handling** patches ([#7](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/7))
- **Sourcemap contents patches** for wasm_of_ocaml improving debugging capabilities ([97c0750](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/97c0750314578ee8d74564611ccdae4f3ac06047))
- **Object stubs patches** across all js_of_ocaml packages for consistent runtime behavior ([97c0750](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/97c0750314578ee8d74564611ccdae4f3ac06047))
- **Version directive removal** patches improving compatibility across packages ([97c0750](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/97c0750314578ee8d74564611ccdae4f3ac06047))
summaries.activity_summary: Comprehensive patch unification and cleanup across all js_of_ocaml packages
summaries.activity:
- **Patch standardization** across js_of_ocaml-compiler, js_of_ocaml-ppx, js_of_ocaml-toplevel, and js_of_ocaml packages ensuring consistent behavior ([#7](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/7))
- **Removal of outdated patches** including js_of_ocaml-ocaml_version-ppx.patch across all packages to address compatibility issues ([523918939](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/523918939a359934505ef66c2eae622676e9b0ab))
- **Addition of new patches** for toplevel, effects, and object stubs functionality with coordinated deployment across the entire js_of_ocaml ecosystem ([97c0750](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/97c0750314578ee8d74564611ccdae4f3ac06047))
summaries.contributors_summary: Jon Ludlam implemented js_of_ocaml toplevel support with comprehensive patch management across packages
summaries.contributors:
- [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) implemented comprehensive **js_of_ocaml toplevel support** including Patrick Ferris's patches for browser-based OCaml toplevel functionality ([#7](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/7))
- [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) unified and standardized patches across all js_of_ocaml packages, removing inconsistencies and deprecated patches while adding new functionality for effects and object stubs ([523918939](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/523918939a359934505ef66c2eae622676e9b0ab), [7aefc10c](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/7aefc10c3c3f7f27b6cf89f9af1c6a57e1a844f8), [97c0750](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/97c0750314578ee8d74564611ccdae4f3ac06047))

summaries.brief_summary: Package fixes for ocaml_simd and build improvements addressing dune sandboxing issues
summaries.new_features_summary: Fixed ocaml_simd installation issues and resolved dune sandboxing problems in ppxlib_ast
summaries.new_features:
- **Fixed ocaml_simd package installation** by updating source archive to a working version and updating compiler tag for ocaml-variants package ([#6](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/6))
- **Resolved dune sandboxing issues** in ppxlib_ast package by removing problematic `set -euo pipefail` from cleanup script that was causing failures in WSL/Ubuntu environments ([#6](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/6))
summaries.activity_summary: Single focused PR addressing package compatibility and build environment issues
summaries.activity: - **Package maintenance work** by [Max Slater](https://github.com/TheNumbat) addressing installation failures and build environment compatibility issues across multiple packages ([#6](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/6))
summaries.contributors_summary: Max Slater contributed package fixes and build environment improvements
summaries.contributors: - [Max Slater](https://github.com/TheNumbat) implemented fixes for ocaml_simd package installation issues and resolved dune sandboxing problems in ppxlib_ast that were affecting WSL/Ubuntu users ([#6](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/6))

summaries.brief_summary: Enhanced CI testing infrastructure with broader Linux distro support and ARM64 architecture testing
summaries.new_features_summary: Added comprehensive CI testing action supporting Ubuntu, Debian, and Arch Linux with ARM64 architecture support
summaries.new_features:
- New **reusable GitHub Action** `test-oxcaml` for setting up OxCaml with predefined opam packages across multiple Linux distributions ([#5](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/5))
- **Multi-distribution CI testing** expanded to include Ubuntu, Debian, and Arch Linux containers with automatic package installation ([#5](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/5))
- **ARM64 architecture support** added to CI testing pipeline for Debian and Ubuntu environments ([#5](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/5))
- **Automatic opam sandboxing detection** and disabling when running inside Docker containers ([#5](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/5))
- **Cross-platform package detection** supporting different package managers (apt-get, pacman) based on Linux distribution ([#5](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/5))
summaries.activity_summary: Improved build system reliability with conf-which dependency addition for better Arch Linux compatibility
summaries.activity:
- **Build dependency enhancement** by adding `conf-which` as a build dependency to improve compatibility with Arch Linux and other distributions ([#4](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/4))
- **Configuration refinement** marking `conf-autoconf` explicitly as a build dependency for clearer dependency management ([#4](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/4))
summaries.trends_summary: Focus on expanding platform compatibility and improving CI infrastructure for broader distribution support
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Platform diversification** with expanded Linux distribution support moving beyond Ubuntu-only testing to include Debian and Arch Linux ([#5](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/5))
- **ARM64 adoption** reflecting industry shift toward ARM-based computing with dedicated testing infrastructure ([#5](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/5))
- **Container-first CI approach** with Docker-based testing environments for consistent cross-platform builds ([#5](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/5))
- **Dependency management improvements** focusing on build-time requirements for better distribution compatibility ([#4](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/4))
summaries.contributors_summary: Single active contributor focused on CI infrastructure improvements and build system enhancements
summaries.contributors:
- [Puneeth Chaganti](https://github.com/punchagan) implemented the comprehensive CI testing infrastructure with multi-distribution support ([#5](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/5)), added build dependency improvements for Arch Linux compatibility ([#4](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/4)), and contributed Docker container integration with automatic sandboxing detection
- [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) provided review feedback and approval for both CI infrastructure improvements ([#5](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/5)) and build dependency enhancements ([#4](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/4))

summaries.brief_summary: Build dependency improvements and GitHub Actions CI setup for package testing
summaries.new_features_summary: Added conf-which build dependency and GitHub Actions for automated package testing
summaries.new_features:
- **Build dependency improvements** with conf-which added as build dependency to support distributions like ArchLinux, and conf-autoconf explicitly marked as build-only dependency ([#4](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/4))
- **Package source update** with updated checksum and direct commit link for OCaml variant 5.2.0+ox package ([50ae6c8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/50ae6c8d27ebd591289d599995008124b554b829))
- **GitHub Actions CI implementation** with automated testing of OCaml variant installation across Ubuntu (x64, arm64) and macOS (Intel, arm64) platforms ([#3](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/3))
summaries.activity_summary: Infrastructure improvements focused on build compatibility and automated testing setup
summaries.activity:
- **Cross-platform compatibility** enhancements by [Puneeth Chaganti](https://github.com/punchagan) addressing build failures on specific Linux distributions through proper dependency management ([#4](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/4))
- **Continuous integration** implementation adding comprehensive GitHub Actions workflow for testing package installations with scheduled nightly builds and PR validation ([#3](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/3))
- **Build script fixes** for ppxlib_ast cleanup script compatibility, ensuring proper bash execution environment ([#1](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/1))
summaries.trends_summary: Focus on build system robustness and automated testing infrastructure
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Build system hardening** through explicit dependency management and cross-platform compatibility testing
- **CI/CD adoption** with comprehensive GitHub Actions workflows for automated package validation across multiple architectures
summaries.contributors_summary: Primary contributions by Puneeth Chaganti with review support from dkalinichenko-js
summaries.contributors:
- [Puneeth Chaganti](https://github.com/punchagan) implemented all merged changes including dependency management improvements ([#4](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/4)), GitHub Actions CI setup ([#3](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/3)), and ppxlib build script fixes ([#1](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/1))
- [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) provided review feedback and expanded package testing scope by adding additional packages to the CI workflow ([#3](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/3), [#4](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/4))

summaries.brief_summary: GitHub Actions CI setup and ppxlib_ast build fixes for OxCaml repository rebranding and improved automation
summaries.new_features_summary: New GitHub Actions CI workflow testing OxCaml package installations across multiple platforms
summaries.new_features:
- **GitHub Actions CI workflow** added to automatically test OxCaml package installations ([#3](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/3))
- **Multi-platform testing** support for Ubuntu (x64, ARM64) and macOS (Intel, ARM64) architectures ([#3](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/3))
- **Nightly cron scheduling** for automated testing of package compatibility ([#3](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/3))
- **Package installation verification** for core development tools: ocamlformat, merlin, ocaml-lsp-server, utop ([#3](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/3))
- **Build script compatibility fix** for ppxlib_ast using bash instead of sh ([#1](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/1), [#2](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/2))
summaries.activity_summary: Repository rebranding from Jane Street extensions to OxCaml with extensive package updates and documentation improvements
summaries.activity:
- **Repository rebranding** from "Jane Street extensions" to **OxCaml** across README and package metadata ([26715a3](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/26715a3b5f0eae6f40352e5ea0e42ffb4b4ecc21))
- **Package suffix migration** from `+jst` to `+ox` across hundreds of packages including Jane Street libraries ([multiple commits](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/compare/83a90c0a9a12ba295c2bb96fae8fa7a6fe2ee17a...26715a3b5f0eae6f40352e5ea0e42ffb4b4ecc21))
- **Documentation updates** improving installation instructions and platform support information in README ([8a89fa2](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/8a89fa2def133816c885b75c1021f6e4218d25b8))
- **Jane Street library updates** to v0.18~preview.130.36+326 versions including core, async, bonsai, and related packages ([0eb8266](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/0eb82660d7b50c5cef30a6ee41402d1467ae8632))
- **Build dependency fixes** adding conf-bash requirement for shell script execution ([#2](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/2))
summaries.trends_summary: Focus on CI automation and package ecosystem stability for OxCaml distribution
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **CI/CD automation** emphasis with comprehensive multi-platform testing infrastructure
- **Package ecosystem consistency** through systematic rebranding and version synchronization
- **Build reliability improvements** addressing shell script compatibility issues
summaries.contributors_summary: Single contributor handling CI setup, build fixes, and repository rebranding
summaries.contributors: - [Puneeth Chaganti](https://github.com/punchagan) implemented the GitHub Actions CI workflow ([#3](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/3)), fixed ppxlib_ast build script issues ([#1](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/1), [#2](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/2)), and coordinated with [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) on package testing improvements

summaries.brief_summary: Jane Street preview release v0.18~preview.130.33+516 with numerous package updates, macOS compatibility fixes, and new MDX support
summaries.new_features_summary: New MDX 2.5.0+jst and backoff 0.1.1+jst packages, extension-universe beta flag, OCaml compiler macOS/ARM fixes, utop debugging improvements
summaries.new_features:
- New **MDX package** 2.5.0+jst added for executable code blocks in markdown documentation ([1f56e059](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/1f56e059da769e834229e3e9321fcb8d9fa20a94))
- New **backoff package** 0.1.1+jst for exponential backoff mechanisms ([447ba6a9](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/447ba6a9018ba043da9692623065f1f19ab918d3))
- **Extension universe** updated from `alpha` to `beta` flag for unstable features like comprehensions ([b2ecd090](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/b2ecd090dff1b2fdac6fc2a3d800645bb927e61a))
- **macOS compatibility fixes** including ARM debugging patches, HAS_HUGE_PAGES compilation fixes, and x86 signal handling ([8aafec1c](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/8aafec1c), [b59c117c](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/b59c117c), [447ba6a9](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/447ba6a9018ba043da9692623065f1f19ab918d3))
- **sigwait functionality** enabled across all platforms by removing conditional compilation ([b59c117c](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/b59c117c893be54e8a57fc408ae0dac86ea497a6))
- **utop integration** fixes for improved REPL experience ([cb6f96e](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/cb6f96eb5fa5c90e9d2b68f7b17248153a1c9e47))
- **Documentation improvements** including autoconf installation notes for Mac users and updated installation instructions ([b2ecd090](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/b2ecd090dff1b2fdac6fc2a3d800645bb927e61a))
summaries.activity_summary: Massive preview release 130.33+516 updating 200+ Jane Street packages with dependency refinements and build system improvements
summaries.activity:
- **Jane Street package update** from v0.18~preview.130.31+242 to v0.18~preview.130.33+516 affecting over 200 packages including core libraries, async modules, ppx extensions, and hardcaml components ([0a64744](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/0a647444))
- **Compiler tooling updates** for merlin (5.2.1-502+jst), ocaml-lsp-server (1.19.0+jst), and dot-merlin-reader with enhanced editor support ([1c94a5e](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/1c94a5e), [4d204e6](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/4d204e6))
- **PPXlib patches** for ast_pattern, attribute handling, and context_free module improvements with expanded documentation ([ccae8cad](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/ccae8cad))
- **js_of_ocaml patches** addressing magic number handling, object stubs, and version directive processing ([various commits](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/ccae8cad))
- **Constraint fixes** and dependency resolution improvements across multiple packages ([ccae8cad](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/ccae8cad))
summaries.contributors_summary: Direct commits without GitHub PR workflow by Jane Street team members for major preview release coordination
summaries.contributors:
- Contributors made direct commits to coordinate the **Jane Street preview release v0.18~preview.130.33+516**, including package version updates, compiler patches, and tooling improvements
- **Platform-specific fixes** contributed for macOS ARM and x86 architectures addressing compilation and runtime issues
- **OCaml tooling maintenance** including merlin, ocaml-lsp-server, and utop integration improvements
- **Documentation updates** improving installation instructions and developer guidance for the oxcaml distribution

summaries.brief_summary: Major package structure reorganization and build system improvements for better opam-repository compatibility
summaries.new_features_summary: Package structure reorganization, build system consolidation, and improved tooling installation workflow
summaries.new_features:
- **Package structure reorganization** to opam-repository compatible layout improving maintainability and compatibility ([96c915c](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/96c915c331d7d9980152dd4d4f7d2e2bd3575024))
- **Build system consolidation** by folding init-compiler, init-dune, and init-menhir packages into ocaml-variants for simplified dependency management ([935b984](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/935b984d61c5a3501f7ca0e6e290a21bfd61e96b), [469c4da](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/469c4da1c727f2be52c6de2327c6db34ce9ba27a))
- **Tooling installation workflow improvements** allowing users to install developer tools without specifying version suffixes ([078589549b6f](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/078589549b6f3ae106a7df9625a767357ecffad6))
- **Build configuration cleanup** removing unused patches and upgrading init-compiler to version 4.14.2 ([28cdd2a](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/28cdd2a7703f3e840f7ae33f4624f0acf0f8c2e6), [d7bd8ce](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/d7bd8cee2e2ea40adf28d69c0ec5a396e6e3e4bd))
summaries.activity_summary: Repository-wide structural improvements and build process optimizations with infrastructure updates
summaries.activity:
- **Infrastructure modernization** through comprehensive package layout migration to standard opam-repository structure affecting hundreds of packages ([867a5d4](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/52))
- **Build process optimization** consolidating multiple initialization packages into single ocaml-variants package reducing complexity ([cbf6161](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/54))
- **Development experience improvements** enabling simplified installation commands for common developer tools like ocamlformat and merlin
- **Maintenance workflow enhancement** removing outdated patches and unused dependencies while upgrading core bootstrap components
summaries.trends_summary: Focus on infrastructure standardization and developer experience improvements
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Infrastructure standardization** movement toward opam-repository compatibility improving ecosystem integration
- **Build system simplification** trend of consolidating complex multi-package dependencies into unified solutions
- **Developer experience optimization** focus on reducing friction in tooling installation and setup workflows
summaries.contributors_summary: Two contributors focused on infrastructure improvements and documentation fixes
summaries.contributors:
- [@art-w](https://github.com/art-w) led the comprehensive package restructuring effort including build system consolidation and infrastructure modernization ([#54](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/54))
- [@cuihtlauac](https://github.com/cuihtlauac) improved documentation by fixing README installation instructions for developer tools ([#52](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/52))

summaries.brief_summary: Repository reorganization with package restructuring and removal of unused init-* packages
summaries.new_features_summary: Compiler upgrade to 4.14.2, package layout migration, and removal of deprecated packages
summaries.new_features:
- **Compiler upgrade** to 4.14.2 in the init-compiler package [28cdd2a](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/28cdd2a7703f3e840f7ae33f4624f0acf0f8c2e6)
- **Package layout migration** to opam-repository compatible structure affecting hundreds of packages [96c915c](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/96c915c331d7d9980152dd4d4f7d2e2bd3575024)
- **Folded init-* packages** into ocaml-variants for better organization [935b984](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/935b984d61c5a3501f7ca0e6e290a21bfd61e96b)
- **Removed unused patches** to clean up repository structure [d7bd8ce](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/d7bd8cee2e2ea40adf28d69c0ec5a396e6e3e4bd)
- **Documentation improvements** in README.md to avoid hardcoded preview version strings [078589](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/078589549b6f3ae106a7df9625a767357ecffad6)
summaries.activity_summary: Major package management reorganization and dependency updates across Jane Street ecosystem
summaries.activity:
- **Repository-wide package restructuring** involving hundreds of Jane Street packages being moved to new directory structure and updated dependencies
- **Jane Street preview packages** mass update to v0.18~preview.130.31+242 affecting nearly 200 packages including async, core, bonsai ecosystems [multiple commits](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/db2ff7dc3dfff6c8e90d7bd08700bbec76efb5da)
- **js_of_ocaml ecosystem** updates including compiler, ppx, and core packages with extensive patch management [multiple commits](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/db2ff7dc3dfff6c8e90d7bd08700bbec76efb5da)
- **Build tool updates** including new versions of alcotest (1.9.0+jst), lwt_ppx (5.9.1+jst), and various development tools [multiple commits](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/db2ff7dc3dfff6c8e90d7bd08700bbec76efb5da)
- **Base dependency management** forced dependency on base preview versions to ensure compatibility [6c275e7](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/6c275e7629407061fbc9c72e672619d542bf4b46)
- **Version bounds updates** and OCamlformat configuration changes to maintain code quality standards [9fcba8f](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/9fcba8f2828b1dd4de45313c7d472a9a0f1b55e7) [7738a45](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/7738a45278891ade37582d3ed6713a2ab9b95136)
summaries.trends_summary: Focus on Jane Street ecosystem modernization and repository structure standardization
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Package ecosystem consolidation** with removal of redundant init-* packages and integration into main ocaml-variants [469c4da](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/469c4da1c727f2be52c6de2327c6db34ce9ba27a)
- **Preview version standardization** across Jane Street packages indicating coordinated release preparation
- **Build system modernization** with updated js_of_ocaml toolchain and enhanced patch management
- **Repository layout standardization** moving toward opam-repository compatible structure for better ecosystem integration
summaries.contributors_summary: [@art-w](https://github.com/art-w) and [Cuihtlauac Alvarado](https://github.com/cuihtlauac) leading repository modernization efforts
summaries.contributors:
- [@art-w](https://github.com/art-w) led the **compiler upgrade** and **package cleanup** efforts, implementing the upgrade to init-compiler 4.14.2 [28cdd2a](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/28cdd2a7703f3e840f7ae33f4624f0acf0f8c2e6), removing unused init-* packages [469c4da](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/469c4da1c727f2be52c6de2327c6db34ce9ba27a), and coordinating the **repository layout migration** [96c915c](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/96c915c331d7d9980152dd4d4f7d2e2bd3575024)
- [Cuihtlauac Alvarado](https://github.com/cuihtlauac) contributed **documentation improvements** by fixing README.md to remove hardcoded preview version strings [078589](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/078589549b6f3ae106a7df9625a767357ecffad6) and implemented **dependency management** changes forcing base preview dependencies [6c275e7](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/6c275e7629407061fbc9c72e672619d542bf4b46)
- [@art-w](https://github.com/art-w) also managed **merge operations** for lwt_ppx, alcotest, and utop package updates, ensuring coordinated integration of new package versions [multiple merge commits](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/f56b95cf04586ec6780ab7c7595d33453ab2b0c3)

summaries.brief_summary: Major Jane Street library release with new packages and extensive js_of_ocaml improvements
summaries.new_features_summary: New float_array, oklab, simple_xml, and toplayer packages; major js_of_ocaml compatibility updates
summaries.new_features:
- New **float_array** package providing mutable vector of floats with efficient O(1) get/set operations ([55a5d4c](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/55a5d4c5e35a7365ddd6ffb3b87274a77f77deb5))
- New **oklab** package implementing oklab color space library with oklch support ([55a5d4c](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/55a5d4c5e35a7365ddd6ffb3b87274a77f77deb5))
- New **simple_xml** package for XML processing functionality ([55a5d4c](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/55a5d4c5e35a7365ddd6ffb3b87274a77f77deb5))
- New **toplayer** package for top-level functionality ([55a5d4c](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/55a5d4c5e35a7365ddd6ffb3b87274a77f77deb5))
- Enhanced **js_of_ocaml compatibility** with OCaml 5.2.0 through updated compiler patches and internal object handling ([3dc83d8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/3dc83d849d8acac8b2846a8e6a104dc68e021bb1))
- New **ojs runtime library** for gen_js_api generated JavaScript bindings with comprehensive patches for globalThis, ppx-driver integration, and multidomain alerts ([3dc83d8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/3dc83d849d8acac8b2846a8e6a104dc68e021bb1))
- Updated **ppxlib** package with enhanced utils, code_matcher, and location_check functionality ([3dc83d8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/3dc83d849d8acac8b2846a8e6a104dc68e021bb1))
summaries.activity_summary: Comprehensive Jane Street ecosystem release updating 200+ packages to v0.18 preview build 242
summaries.activity:
- **Mass package update** from Jane Street ecosystem with public-release automation updating all v0.18~preview packages from build 130.26+1192 to 130.31+242 ([55a5d4c](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/55a5d4c5e35a7365ddd6ffb3b87274a77f77deb5))
- **JavaScript ecosystem enhancements** by [Diana Kalinichenko](https://github.com/dkalinichenko) including major js_of_ocaml package updates with OCaml 5.2.0 compatibility patches ([3dc83d8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/3dc83d849d8acac8b2846a8e6a104dc68e021bb1))
- **Build system improvements** across core packages including async, bonsai, core, ecaml, and PPX extensions with updated dependencies and build configurations
- **OCaml variant updates** including ocaml-variants.5.2.0+flambda2 compiler improvements and ocaml_intrinsics_kernel patch removals ([3dc83d8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/3dc83d849d8acac8b2846a8e6a104dc68e021bb1), [55a5d4c](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/55a5d4c5e35a7365ddd6ffb3b87274a77f77deb5))
summaries.contributors_summary: Jane Street automated release system and Diana Kalinichenko drove all development activity this week
summaries.contributors:
- **Jane Street automated release system** (public-release@janestreet.com) performed the major coordinated release update across 200+ packages, updating version numbers, dependencies, and build configurations ([55a5d4c](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/55a5d4c5e35a7365ddd6ffb3b87274a77f77deb5))
- [**Diana Kalinichenko**](https://github.com/dkalinichenko) implemented comprehensive JavaScript ecosystem improvements including js_of_ocaml compatibility updates, new ojs package creation, and PPX library enhancements ([3dc83d8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/3dc83d849d8acac8b2846a8e6a104dc68e021bb1))

summaries.brief_summary: Large-scale Jane Street packages update to v0.18~preview.130.26+1192 with js_of_ocaml compiler upgrade to 6.0.1+jst
summaries.new_features_summary: Updated Jane Street ecosystem to v0.18~preview.130.26+1192 and upgraded js_of_ocaml toolchain to 6.0.1+jst
summaries.new_features:
- **Jane Street ecosystem update** with comprehensive release of v0.18~preview.130.26+1192 across core libraries including core, async, bonsai, hardcaml and related packages ([29ae8c3](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/29ae8c316f52fa2d2675077e496ca549ea156510))
- **js_of_ocaml toolchain upgrade** to version 6.0.1+jst with extensive patch updates for OCaml 5.2 compatibility and performance improvements ([d0e9f8a](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/d0e9f8a484ffbdb3017ec61ad8ae3f000c398b8b))
- **New package additions** including basement.v0.18~preview.130.26+1192 and command_nodejs.v0.18~preview.130.26+1192 extending the Jane Street ecosystem
- **Enhanced js_of_ocaml patches** with new bigstring reader bugfixes, array append optimizations, and improved sourcemap support for better debugging experience
- **Updated build dependencies** across all Jane Street packages to require OCaml >= 5.1.0 and dune >= 3.17.0 for modern toolchain compatibility
